{{cpp/title|unsigned_integral}}
{{cpp/concepts/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=concepts|since=c++20|1=
template&lt; class T &gt;
concept unsigned_integral = std::integral&lt;T&gt; &amp;&amp; !std::signed_integral&lt;T&gt;;
}}

The concept {{tt|unsigned_integral&lt;T&gt;}} is satisfied if and only if {{tt|T}} is an integral type and {{c|std::is_signed_v&lt;T&gt;}} is {{c|false}}.

===Notes===
{{tt|unsigned_integral&lt;T&gt;}} may be satisfied by a type that is not an [[cpp/language/type#Type classification|unsigned integer type]], for example, {{c/core|bool}}.
